title: CNN asks Rwandan president about trial of 'Hotel Rwanda' hero
description: CNN's Richard Quest talks to Rwandan President Paul Kagame about the terrorism trial for Paul Rusesabagina, the real-life inspiration for the movie "Hotel Rwanda."

title: Erling Braut Haaland: The making of football's 'humble' superstar
description: Alfe Ingve Berntsen remembers the first time he laid eyes on this scrawny kid with an appetite for goals.

title: Millions still without power in the US
description: As millions of people across the United States continue to weather a deadly winter storm without power, forecasts predict ice and low temperatures could be ahead for some of the worst-hit states.

title: What's behind Biden's snub of the Saudi Crown Prince
description: In a region where respect, or the lack of it, is as powerful as a physical punch, President Joe Biden's press secretary just landed a sharp jab on the jaw of Saudi Arabia's heir apparent.

title: NY assemblyman alleges Cuomo threatened him over Covid-19 nursing homes scandal
description: New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo has been pleading with lawmakers for support and even threatening political retribution against Democrats who have criticized him in an aggressive effort to contain political fallout from revelations that his administration had concealed the full extent of nursing home-related deaths during the Covid pandemic.

title: NY assemblyman alleges Cuomo threatened him over Covid-19 nursing homes scandal
Stunning images show the aftermath of power outages in Texas
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar speaks with Daniel Cohan, a professor at Rice University, about the power outages in Texas due to the severe winter weather.

title: 'Win or we kill you:' Tensions rise as soccer giant faces unprecedented relegation
description: The unthinkable could be about to happen.

title: Rush Limbaugh, conservative media firebrand, dies aged 70
description: Rush Limbaugh, the conservative media icon who for decades used his perch as the king of talk-radio to shape the politics of both the Republican Party and nation, died Wednesday after a battle with cancer. He was 70 years old.

title: Dinosaurs may not have been killed off by an asteroid
description: Dinosaurs might have been wiped out by a comet instead of an asteroid, a new study says.

title: Terrifying footage shows attacks on Asian Americans amid pandemic
description: A string of recent Covid-related attacks against Asian Americans has communities on high alert. CNN's Kyung Lah reports.

title: These voters pressed Biden on key issues. Here's what they said about his answers
Why I'll be sweating out seven minutes of the Mars mission
description: In the depths of space, a speeding projectile races away from Earth and toward a date with destiny.

title: Sorry, America: Europe has a new No. 1 trading partner for goods
description: Europe is now trading more goods with China than the United States, a sign of how the pandemic is transforming the global economy.

title: Amazon just teased 3 new products. They may never hit the market
description: Amazon announced three new Alexa-enabled products on Wednesday: a smart sticky note printer, nutrition scale and cuckoo clock. But there's a catch -- the tech giant will only ship these items if enough people pre-order them.

title: World No. 1 stunned in Australian Open quarterfinals
The single most ridiculous claim in Trump's statement slamming Mitch McConnell
description: Former President Donald Trump made a number of wild claims in a statement Tuesday savaging Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell. But one really stood out to me: His insistence that he had "single-handedly saved" more than a dozen Senate seats -- including McConnell's! -- from falling into the clutches of Democrats over the past two elections.

title: Ashley Judd shares harrowing details from accident in Congo
description: Actress Ashley Judd is grateful to the Congolese people who helped her in her time of need.

title: Adam Sandler recreates iconic swing on 25th anniversary of 'Happy Gilmore'
description: Adam Sandler and Christopher McDonald have marked the 25th anniversary of "Happy Gilmore" by sharing videos of their golf swings.

title: Chinese drone company's shares plunge after fraud claim
description: Investors are dumping shares in Chinese drone maker EHang, after a short-seller accused the US-listed company of fraud.

title: World's oldest DNA sequenced from mammoth tooth
description: A tooth from a mammoth that roamed the Siberian steppe more than a million years ago has yielded the world's oldest DNA sequence.

title: Who's actually to blame for the Texas power disaster?
description: With millions of Texans still without power in the wake of a winter storm and frigid temperatures, everyone is looking for someone to blame.

title: The health benefits of a random act of kindness
description: This year's "Random Acts of Kindness" Day falls during a pandemic, but the foundation behind it wants you to consider being kind every day.

title: Trump's Atlantic City casino imploded after being closed since 2014
description: The Trump Plaza Hotel and Casino in Atlantic City was demolished after being closed since 2014. Donald Trump opened it in 1984.

title: UK's Prince Philip taken to London hospital after feeling unwell
description: Prince Philip, the 99-year-old husband of Queen Elizabeth, has been taken to a London hospital after feeling unwell, according to a Buckingham Palace press release.

title: One student killed and dozens feared kidnapped after armed men storm school
description: One person has died and dozens of students feared abducted as armed men raided a state-run school in Niger state, in Nigeria's Middle Belt region early Wednesday.

title: Ford investing $1 billion in Germany as it goes electric in Europe
description: Ford is spending $1 billion to modernize a plant in Germany as part of a plan to sell only electric passenger cars in Europe by 2030.

title: The climate champions who are really hypocrites
description: In Oslo, the street lamps are powered by renewables. To conserve energy, the smart lights dim when nobody is around. The Norwegian capital, like the rest of the country, is proud of its exceptional green credentials. Its public transportation system too is powered entirely by renewable energy. Two thirds of new cars sold in the city are electric. There's even a highway for bees.

title: World No. 1 stunned by comeback queen in Australian Open quarterfinals
description: World No. 1 and home favorite Ashleigh Barty exited the Australian Open after she was stunned by Karolina Muchova in the quarterfinals on Wednesday.

title: The gaming world often overlooks players of color. This new studio is changing that
description: At age nine, Nicodemus Madehdou moved from Monrovia, Liberia to Philadelphia and discovered how video games could connect him to a new culture. Always a puzzle aficionado, Madehdou liked the ways that visual exercises could be translated into the virtual world through gaming.

title: Influencers take to social media to stand against Asian hate crimes in the US
description: Following a wave of anti-Asian hate crimes taking place in the US in recent weeks, prominent figures from across the fashion industry are coming together to voice their concern and condemn the violence.

title: Why families stuck inside together just text each other all day
description: Early in the pandemic, Jane Cox Childress brought her teenage son warm cookies at his desk during a remote learning session. She received a text message in response: "Mom, could you please not bring me anything when I'm in class?"

title: These voters pressed Biden on key issues. Here's what they said about his answers.
description:
• Analysis: 6 takeaways from Biden's town hall
• Analysis: Biden seeks to move on from pandemic denial and division
• Analysis: The most ridiculous claim in Trump's statement slamming Mitch McConnell

title: A majority of Britons aren't satisfied with how Brexit turned out
description: A majority of Britons are not satisfied with the post-Brexit trade agreement that Boris Johnson secured with the European Union, according to a survey that provides the first detailed insight into the nation's attitude towards the deal since it took effect.

title: Rapper's arrest sparks protests in Catalonia
description: Protesters took to the streets in Barcelona and Girona, in Spain's northeastern Catalonia region, on Tuesday night following the dramatic arrest of rapper Pablo Hasel earlier in the day.

title: Artwork made of 5,000 images captured over 13 years to go on sale in auction house first
description: A collage comprised of 5,000 images taken over the course of 13 years by digital artist Beeple will become the first of its kind to go under the hammer at a major auction house, Christie's has announced.

title: How the UK got its vaccine rollout strategy right
description: Last May, Steve Bates' phone rang. The UK was in the midst of its first national lockdown -- there was a stay-at-home order, schools and most shops were closed, and experts were warning that a vaccine could still be years out.

title: Nigerian entrepreneur jailed for 10 years in $11m email scam
description: Celebrated Nigerian entrepreneur Obinwanne Okeke has been jailed for 10 years by a US federal court for masterminding an $11 million cyber fraud on a British company.

title: A single tweet from Elon Musk can send a stock soaring. Traders should beware
description: Why worry about earnings growth and valuations when you can just plow your money into whatever "stonks" mega-billionaire Elon Musk happens to tweet about?

title: Family of teen killed by diplomat's wife can bring damage claims in US, judge rules
description: A judge in the United States on Tuesday ruled that a civil claim for damages against Anne Sacoolas -- the woman accused of killing 19-year-old Harry Dunn while she was driving on the wrong side of the road in England -- can be heard in Virginia, according to court documents seen by CNN.

title: Madonna's daughter Lourdes announced as the new face of Marc Jacobs
description: Lourdes "Lola" Leon, daughter of pop icon Madonna, is the new face for The Marc Jacobs' Spring 2021 campaign.

title: This country had the only positive tourism story of 2020
description: In most destinations, being a million tourists short over the previous year would be a huge cause for concern, the result of a horrible natural disaster. But that was before 2020, and before the coronavirus pandemic changed the way we travel forever.

title: Mysteries of massive holes forming in Siberian permafrost unlocked by scientists
description: Drone photography, 3D modeling and artificial intelligence are now helping scientists understand how a number of massive craters have formed in the Siberian tundra -- a dramatic and new geological phenomenon thought to be linked to climate change.

title: US steps up military presence in South China Sea
description: A US Navy warship sailed by islands claimed by China in the South China Sea on Wednesday, the second such sailing in as many weeks, as the Biden administration steps up the US' military presence in the disputed waters.

title: Rihanna sparks backlash after wearing Ganesha pendant in topless photo
description: Rihanna is facing accusations of cultural appropriation and religious insensitivity after she posted a topless image of herself wearing a pendant depicting the Hindu god Ganesha.

title: 'Terrified' UN envoy issues warning on Myanmar as protesters face down military
Biden reveals conversation with Xi Jinping on human rights
description: President Joe Biden revealed his conversation with Chinese president Xi Jinping on human rights issues during CNN's presidential town hall.

title: Biden cracks a joke when asked about what it's like in White House now
description: CNN's Anderson Cooper asks President Joe Biden what it's like being in the White House as President.
